github.lightningcreations.lcjei

Interface IEngineInterface<GameType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GameType - The type of the Game which is used by the Engine.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    WrappedEngine

    public interface IEngineInterface<GameType>
extends Runnable
    Class Representing an Interface to a Game Engine that runs games of a specified type.
    Provided a way to access this Interface is the minimum requirements for Compliance with the Lightning Creations Java Game Interface Specification.
    This Interface makes it possible for game engines to delegate to other game engines, wrap games from other engines, or even embed games from other engines to other games.
    All Methods are allowed to check an unspecified permission with the System or some other unspecified Security Manager. As such, all methods can possibly throw a SecurityException. IEngineInterfaces are intended to be created in an uninitialized state. However, implementations may provide methods of wrapping active engines in an LCJEI IEngineInterface. As such these methods create or return an IEngineInterface in an implementation-specific, but valid state. Consult the documentation for the specific implementation for what states these methods leave the interface in.
    Author:
    chorm

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Finalizes the engine and destroys any implementation created frame.
      Container getCurrentDrawContainer()
      Obtains a container, that when drawn to, draws to the same pane as the Engine is currently drawing to.
      If the engine was initialized with a call to initialize(Container) for a non-null Container c, and that call returned true, then Container returns c or a child of c.
      default IGameInfo<GameType> getGameInfo()
      Obtains information about the current game object.
      This is an optional operation.
      GameType getGameObject()
      Gets the internal game object.
      void initialize()
      Initializes the Engine in an Implementation-Specific manner.
      Usually the drawing pane is a frame created by the implementation.
      This method may not be called after it or initialize(Container) succesfully returns, until a call to destroy() sucessfully returns.
      boolean initialize(Container c)
      Initializes the Engine referenced by this Interface.
      The Engine is requested, though not strictly required, to render the graphical output to Component.
      If c is null, has the same effect as initialize().
      This may not be called after a call to initialize, unless a subsequent call to destroy has been made.
      void resume()
      Resumes execution of a suspended game.
      void run()
      Executes the game.
      void suspend()
      Causes game execution to halt temporarily.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        boolean initialize(Container c)
            throws IllegalStateException
        Initializes the Engine referenced by this Interface.
        The Engine is requested, though not strictly required, to render the graphical output to Component.
        If c is null, has the same effect as initialize().
        This may not be called after a call to initialize, unless a subsequent call to destroy has been made. If this method is called in violation of this requirement, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        After this call, the engine MUST be in an Initialized State unless this method threw an exception
        It must be possible to draw to c, and c MUST be visible or an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        c - The container to draw to. This parameter may be ignored and may be null. If ignored or null, false is returned, and the results are identical to initialize().
        Returns:
        true iff c is not null, and the implementation initializes the state to draw to c.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Engine has already been initialized and not yet destroyed.
        IllegalArgumentException - if c is not visible, cannot be made visible by a call to setVisible(true), or it is otherwise not possible to paint c.

      • initialize

        void initialize()
         throws IllegalStateException
        Initializes the Engine in an Implementation-Specific manner.
        Usually the drawing pane is a frame created by the implementation.
        This method may not be called after it or initialize(Container) succesfully returns, until a call to destroy() sucessfully returns. Attempts to call this method in violation of this contract causes a IllegalStateException to be thrown.
        After this call, the engine shall be in an initialized state.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Engine has already been initialized and not yet destroyed

      • destroy

        void destroy()
      throws IllegalStateException
        Finalizes the engine and destroys any implementation created frame.
        If the engine is drawing to a user supplied Container passed via initialize(Container), this container is not freed or cleared.
        This method may only be called after a call to any initialize that succesfully returns, but not after a call to destroy that succesfully returns which is not followed by a such a call to initialized. Attempting to call this method in violation of this contract causes a IllegalStateException. After this call, the engine shall be in an uninitialized state and can be discarded or reused.
        Destroying an engine in a suspended state shall be well-defined, but has unspecified results. The results of garbage collecting an EngineInterface object that refers to an engine that has been initialized but not destroyed are undefined.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Engine has not yet been initialized or has been destroyed without being reinitialized

      • run

        void run()
  throws IllegalStateException
        Executes the game. This method returns immediately
        This method MUST only be called between succesfull calls of initialize and destroy, and may be called at most once between each call to initialize and destroy.
        After a succesful call to this method, the engine shall be executing.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the method is called before the Engine is initialized, or after it is destroyed but before it has been reininitialized, or has been called multiple times between a succesful call to initialize and destory.

      • getCurrentDrawContainer

        Container getCurrentDrawContainer()
        Obtains a container, that when drawn to, draws to the same pane as the Engine is currently drawing to.
        If the engine was initialized with a call to initialize(Container) for a non-null Container c, and that call returned true, then Container returns c or a child of c.
        Otherwise the result is unspecified. Such a container is invalidated by a call to destroy(), and use of that object passed that point has undefined results.
        This method MUST be called between successful calls of initialize and destroy. Calling this method in violation of this contract causes a IllegalStateException to be thrown.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the method is called before the Engine is initialized, or after it is destroyed but before it has been reininitialized.

      • getGameObject

        GameType getGameObject()
        Gets the internal game object.
        The result of this method is unspecified.
        Unlike other methods, this can be called at any time.

      • getGameInfo

        default IGameInfo<GameType> getGameInfo()
                                 throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains information about the current game object.
        This is an optional operation. By default it returns null.
        Implementations are permitted to throw a UnsupportedOperationException.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException

      • suspend

        void suspend()
      throws IllegalStateException
        Causes game execution to halt temporarily. It can be resumed by a call to resume(). If called from a Thread that is started as part of game execution, the results are undefined.
        This method may not be called unless the game is executing (that is, run() has succesfully returned), and the game is not suspended. Calls to this method made in violation of this rule cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown.
        After this call, the engine shall be in a suspended state.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the method is called on an engine that is not in an executing state.

      • resume

        void resume()
     throws IllegalStateException
        Resumes execution of a suspended game.
        This method may only be called on an engine in a suspended state. Calls to this method in violation of this contract cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown.
        After this call, the engine shall be in an executing state.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the method is called on an engine that is not in a suspended state.
